TopicTitle: Saw the North Korean launch today

Articles.Content: It looked strangely familiar..
Thanks for the laugh.

For all those who can\'t get their rocket into orbit.

Don\'t worry guys, nor can the North Koreans.

Heck back in the day the USSR and the USA had the same issues...
Next time.

Should have used ASAS.

Either that or

MORE BOOSTERS!!!
maybe they\'re getting us used to failed launches so that they can drop a \'failed\' upper stage into downtown Seoul with it\'s toxic rcs fuel
Hey, it\'s not like the south koreans can do any better.
I like it!

For all those who can\'t get their rocket into orbit.

Don\'t worry guys, nor can the North Koreans.

Heck back in the day the USSR and the USA had the same issues...

The difference is that the USA and the USSR had enough money to keep trying. I have a feeling it\'s going to be a while before NK can afford to build another one.
Well, they don\'t really spend money for anything else than military...

Hey, it\'s not like the south koreans can do any better.

The North Koreans are lead by a slightly more... militant government.

At least, that\'s the impression I got from BBC News.
Also South Korea is a high tech country, whilest the north would starvate without the help of China
Dont know if its good or bad that my colleagues asked me if i designed the nk rocket, since they know i love kerbal...

Haha

Good one!
Tell them that you added a Kerbal surprise for them because Harvester whould give you money if the government buyed KSP in reason of that ;P
Recently, they\'ve actually been giving us weapons in exchange for food. Life\'s bad, man.
I heard it didn\'t work or something. But I\'m not sure how reliable Yahoo is.
Splashed into the water after 2 mins. Things learned: don\'t steal MechJeb code when making a real autopilot...

Recently, they\'ve actually been giving us weapons in exchange for food. Life\'s bad, man.

What are we doing with the weapons? Recycling them?

What are we doing with the weapons? Recycling them?

No idea. Probably selling them to other countries in exchange for more UAV\'s. Those things are terrifying.

No idea. Probably selling them to other countries in exchange for more UAV\'s. Those things are terrifying.

I thought countries bought the US\'s UAV\'s? Or do you mean the materials for them.

I thought countries bought the US\'s UAV\'s? Or do you mean the materials for them.

I\'m pretty sure the US is one of the few countries to be able to afford / fly UAV\'s. But then again, the military could just be keeping the weapons we buy in a huge basement.

But then again, the military could just be keeping the weapons we buy in a huge basement.

Sounds like something that would be done.
I have almost no doubt that the US could take over the world within 40 years. Or just a few short days if we bring nukes into the equation.

I have almost no doubt that the US could take over the world within 40 years. Or just a few short days if we bring nukes into the equation.

Take over, my arse. They can barely hold Iraq; how are they going to occupy a major country?
